c74object.name: fl.sort~
c74object.digest: Sorts an input frame into ascending or descending order
c74object.description: The sort can either be on values or indices as set by the indices parameter.

entry.name: /order [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the ordering of the sorted output.
[0] - up[1] - down

entry.name: /indices [bool]
entry.description: Performs the sort on the indices of the input rather than the values.

objarg.name: order
objarg.digest: Sets the ordering of the sorted output
objarg.description:
This argument sets the order parameter:
Sets the ordering of the sorted output.
[0] - up[1] - down

objarg.name: indices
objarg.digest: Performs the sort on the indices of the input rather than the values
objarg.description:
This argument sets the indices parameter:
Performs the sort on the indices of the input rather than the values.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.sort~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.sort~. When set to 0 fl.sort~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.sort~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
